text.div:
Generated Narrative: CodeSystem space-visual-effects-cs

This case-sensitive code system https://mitre.org/fhir/space-health/CodeSystem/space-visual-effects-cs defines the following codes:

CodeDisplayDefinition
sans Spaceflight-Associated Neuro-ocular SyndromeA constellation of ocular and brain findings in astronauts exposed to long-duration spaceflight, including optic disc edema, globe flattening, choroidal folds, and hyperopic shifts
optic-disc-edema Optic Disc EdemaSwelling of the optic disc observed in astronauts during long-duration spaceflight
posterior-globe-flattening Posterior Globe FlatteningFlattening of the posterior portion of the eye globe observed in astronauts during spaceflight
choroidal-folds Choroidal FoldsFolds in the choroidal layer of the eye observed in astronauts during spaceflight
hyperopic-shift Hyperopic ShiftA shift toward farsightedness observed in astronauts during spaceflight
space-radiation-cataracts Space Radiation CataractsCataracts resulting from exposure to space radiation
light-flash-phenomenon Light Flash PhenomenonVisual perception of flashes of light caused by cosmic rays interacting with the retina or visual cortex
retinal-vascular-changes Retinal Vascular ChangesChanges in the blood vessels of the retina observed during spaceflight

name: SpaceVisualEffectsCodeSystem
title: Space Visual Effects
description: CodeSystem for space visual effects not found in SNOMED CT

concept.definition: A constellation of ocular and brain findings in astronauts exposed to long-duration spaceflight, including optic disc edema, globe flattening, choroidal folds, and hyperopic shifts
Swelling of the optic disc observed in astronauts during long-duration spaceflight
Flattening of the posterior portion of the eye globe observed in astronauts during spaceflight
Folds in the choroidal layer of the eye observed in astronauts during spaceflight
A shift toward farsightedness observed in astronauts during spaceflight
Cataracts resulting from exposure to space radiation
Visual perception of flashes of light caused by cosmic rays interacting with the retina or visual cortex
Changes in the blood vessels of the retina observed during spaceflight
